metadata.title: CVE-2021-29948 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Signatures are written to disk before and read during verification, whichmight be subject to a race condition when a malicious local process or useris replacing the file. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
